name: Chudu
instructions: Make small balls from the dough and flatten them into thin discs.
Place a spoonful of the potato, onion, green chilies and coriander leaves mixture in the center of each disc.
Fold the disc in half to form a semi-circular shape and seal the edges by pressing them together.
Heat oil in a pan and fry the chudu until golden brown on both sides.
Serve hot.

name: Mud Upma
instructions: Roast the semolina (rava) in a pan until fragrant and lightly browned.
Bring the water to a boil in a saucepan.
Add the roasted semolina to the boiling water and stir constantly to prevent lumps.
Reduce the heat to low, cover, and cook for about 10 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the semolina is cooked through.
In a separate pan, heat oil and add the mustard seeds. Once they start to splutter, add the urad dal and curry leaves.

Add the chili powder and salt to taste.
Combine the semolina mixture and the tempering mixture, and mix well.

name: Osra
instructions: Mix the rice flour and water to make a smooth batter.
Add the grated coconut, jaggery, green chilies, and curry leaves to the batter.
Mix well and add salt to taste.
Pour the batter into a greased steamer and steam for about 15-20 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted comes out clean.
Serve hot.

name: Dum Aloo
instructions: Par-boil the potatoes until slightly tender, then halve them.
In a bowl, mix the yogurt, onion, ginger-garlic paste, coriander powder, cumin powder, and red chili powder. Add salt to taste.
Heat oil in a pan and fry the par-boiled potato halves until golden brown.
Add the yogurt-spice mixture to the pan and mix well. Pour in the water and bring to a simmer.
Cover and cook for 15-20 minutes, or until the potatoes are tender and the gravy has thickened.
Serve hot, garnished with fresh coriander leaves if desired.

name: Uni Aloo
instructions: Boil the potatoes until tender, then halve them.
In a pan, heat oil and fry the potato halves until golden brown.
Add the chopped onion, ginger-garlic paste, and spices (coriander powder, cumin powder, red chili powder).
